ygData.subject: Re: In response to the Plea for help
ygData.msgSnippet: ... FOr ... I Some people are weak, and it frightens me their lack of self- accountability, or better yet grasp of reality. Do they need help? Sure do. Is
ygData.messageBody:
> A few people every year suicide because of role playing. Why?
> becuece they put too much of them selves into their charactors.
FOr
> some it was they brought their toons into the real world and died
> thinking they could have special powers if they really tried(guess
> the pavement disagreed). For others their toon was them( the real
> world person locked them selves in their own minds and only
> interacted as the toon.( most of these we lock up in time but some
> are missed) IN everquest most people have at least 3 toons( think
I



Some people are weak, and it frightens me their lack of self-
accountability, or better yet grasp of reality. Do they need help?
Sure do. Is Everquest to blame for this? When Gary Condit gives us a
straight answer. Whatever the opinions are for what the Stein's did
will be entirely subjective. The kid DID need order and to learn self-
control (something no game will ever provide anyway) but I do agree
blaming it on a video game is pretty ludicrous and asinine. I also
remember the case with the young man committing suicide and his
mother blaming it on Verant. Sad as it was, I was shocked and
annoyed. Again, self-accountability, something we Americans, by
individual, lack completely.

Digital
